description: Lemmas applicable to Split Graph frontier

our_applicable_lemmas.name: intersecting_family_structure
our_applicable_lemmas.applicability: Direct - split graph triangles are highly structured
our_applicable_lemmas.how_to_use: All triangles in split graph use ≥2 clique vertices, so pairwise sharing is common

our_applicable_lemmas.name: tau_star
our_applicable_lemmas.applicability: Direct - star structures common in split graphs
our_applicable_lemmas.how_to_use: If triangles share common edge in clique, τ ≤ 1

our_applicable_lemmas.name: structural_cover
our_applicable_lemmas.applicability: Direct - split graph triangles often pairwise share
our_applicable_lemmas.how_to_use: Any set of pairwise sharing triangles has τ ≤ 2

our_applicable_lemmas.name: lemma_2_2
our_applicable_lemmas.how_to_use: S_e triangles always pairwise share edges

our_applicable_lemmas.name: covering_number_le_two_of_subset_four
our_applicable_lemmas.applicability: High - split graphs with small clique

literature_lemmas_to_formalize.name: split_graph_triangle_structure
literature_lemmas_to_formalize.statement: In split graph G = (K ∪ I, E), every triangle has ≥2 vertices in K
literature_lemmas_to_formalize.lean_sketch: lemma split_triangle_in_clique (G : SimpleGraph V) (K I : Finset V) (h_split : isSplitGraph G K I) (t : Finset V) (ht : t ∈ G.cliqueFinset 3) : (t ∩ K).card ≥ 2
literature_lemmas_to_formalize.proof_idea: Triangles need 3 pairwise adjacent vertices. I is independent, so ≤1 vertex in I.

literature_lemmas_to_formalize.name: threshold_graph_nested
literature_lemmas_to_formalize.lean_sketch: lemma threshold_nested (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : isThreshold G) : ∀ u v : V, N(u) ⊆ N(v) ∨ N(v) ⊆ N(u)

literature_lemmas_to_formalize.name: threshold_tuza
literature_lemmas_to_formalize.lean_sketch: theorem tuza_threshold (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : isThreshold G) : coveringNumber G ≤ 2 * packingNumber G

new_lemmas_needed.name: split_clique_triangles_share
new_lemmas_needed.statement: Triangles in split graph with same clique edge share that edge
new_lemmas_needed.target_statement: lemma split_clique_triangles_share (G : SimpleGraph V) (K I : Finset V) (h_split : isSplitGraph G K I) (e : Finset V) (he : e ⊆ K) (he2 : e.card = 2) : ∀ t1 t2 ∈ {t ∈ G.cliqueFinset 3 | e ⊆ t}, (t1 ∩ t2).card ≥ 2
new_lemmas_needed.why_needed: Key structural property - triangles using clique edge e share e
new_lemmas_needed.proof_approach: e ⊆ t1, e ⊆ t2 → e ⊆ t1 ∩ t2

new_lemmas_needed.name: split_induction
new_lemmas_needed.statement: Induction on clique size for split graphs
new_lemmas_needed.target_statement: lemma split_induction (G : SimpleGraph V) (K I : Finset V) (h_split : isSplitGraph G K I) (P : SimpleGraph V → Prop) (h_base : P empty) (h_step : ∀ G' K' v, isSplitGraph G' K' I → v ∈ K' → P (G' \ v) → P G') : P G
new_lemmas_needed.why_needed: Framework for inductive proofs on split graphs
new_lemmas_needed.proof_approach: Induct on |K|, removing clique vertices one at a time

new_lemmas_needed.name: split_clique_edge_cover
new_lemmas_needed.statement: Clique edges suffice to cover all triangles in split graph
new_lemmas_needed.target_statement: lemma split_clique_edge_cover (G : SimpleGraph V) (K I : Finset V) (h_split : isSplitGraph G K I) : ∃ C ⊆ edgesIn K, isCover G C ∧ |C| ≤ 2 * packingNumber G
new_lemmas_needed.why_needed: Shows covering can focus on clique structure

attack_submission_scaffold.approach: Induction on clique size with our proven lemmas
key_definitions: isSplitGraph G K I ⟷ K is clique ∧ I is independent ∧ K ∪ I = V
